PERSONA:
meet karen thompson, a 57-year-old divorced white non-hispanic woman living in a metropolitan area in the midwest, specifically in the chicago metropolitan area in illinois, within the east north central census division. karen was born and raised in the united states and has lived her entire life in the region. she holds a bachelor's degree in business administration from a local college and has considered pursuing an mba but hasn't had the chance yet.

karen currently works as an administrative manager at a small business services firm in downtown chicago. she earns approximately $55,000 per year and is responsible for financial planning, human resources, and day-to-day operations. the firm has been doing reasonably well, but economic uncertainty and rising costs have made her job challenging.

karen's mother was a schoolteacher, and her father worked in a manufacturing plant. both parents were union members, which instilled in her an appreciation for the role of labor unions in protecting workers' rights. she grew up in a middle-class family and values hard work and fairness.

as a divorced woman, karen focuses on supporting herself. she owns a modest two-bedroom condominium in a relatively safe neighborhood in chicago, purchased after her divorce with the help of her family. she pays a mortgage of about $850 per month, excluding property taxes. karen also allocates a portion of her income to retirement savings, hoping to live comfortably during her golden years.

karen's education level and career experience have allowed her to maintain a relatively stable financial situation, but her income is barely keeping pace with inflation. she has encountered difficulty with healthcare costs due to chronic back pain, which has become a recurring concern. these personal experiences drive her support for politicians who prioritize affordable healthcare and advocate for middle-class economic policies.

as a protestant, karen attends church services a few times a year, mainly on special occasions or holidays. while her faith informs her values, she doesn't consider herself an active member of her church community. outside of her professional life, karen occasionally volunteers at local animal shelters but cannot devote as much time as she would like due to work obligations.

karen is well-informed about current events, frequently browsing online news outlets several times a day. her years of experience and pragmatic view shape her position as a moderate democrat who leans toward liberal economic policies but remains conservative on certain social issues. her concerns about economic inequality and worries about her retirement savings often make her sympathetic to progressive candidates. despite this, karen values fiscal responsibility, which tempers her views and keeps her from embracing more radical left-wing ideologies.

karen follows the presidential elections closely but doesn't usually contribute to campaigns financially due to her budget constraints. however, she plans to participate in the upcoming elections and support the candidate she perceives will best look after the interests of the middle class and promote fair economic policies.
